title: Animal Rights and the Law
description: A quick, practical guide to Animal Rights and the Law.

hook.text: A chimpanzee can solve puzzles, feel pain, and grieve. Should it have legal rights? The law says noâ€”for now.

buildup.text: Animals are legally classified as property. Anti-cruelty laws protect them from abuse but don't grant them rights.

discovery.text: Peter Singer argues that capacity to sufferâ€”not speciesâ€”should determine moral and legal consideration.

twist.text: The Nonhuman Rights Project has sued for habeas corpus for chimps and elephants. Courts have rejected the claims.

climax.text: Some countries grant limited rights to animals: India recognizes dolphins as 'non-human persons.'

punchline.text: Rights require legal personhood. Whether animals qualify is the open question.
